title: MIBI_Training_Pipeline-nf pipeline parameters
description: Workflow to train a ML classifier.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

run_name.description: Run name used to label output files.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1_preprocessed_input_data.csv

label_file.description: File containing cell type labels. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1_cell_type_labels.csv

output_path.description: Path to directory to store output files. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1-results

preprocess_schemes.description: A comma delimited list of the schemes to use to transform the input data.

balance_schemes.description: A comma delimited list of the schemes to use to balance the input data.

bayescv_iterations.description: Comma delimited list of numbers of parameter settings that are sampled in Bayes Search CV.

options_toml.description: TOML file containing preprocessing scheme and model classifier options. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1-options.toml

decoder.description: JSON file containing the decoder for the predicted cell types. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1_decoder.json

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.
